poem:
### Distances Unspoken

In the valley's shadow,  
echoes linger:  
words of denial  
drift on fractured air.  
  
Mountains cradle silence—  
tension and terrain.  
Explosions feathered away,  
an unclaimed sky—  
who speaks in whispers?  
  
Here, truth pauses  
between breaths,  
in contested spaces  
where silence  
wears the weight  
of distant thunder.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Explosions reported in Jammu city in India-administered Kashmir – live updates 7.06pm BST Pakistan denies attack on Indian-administered Kashmir Here’s more from Pakistan’s defence minister, Khawaja Asif, after reports of explosions in Jammu city in Indian-administered Kashmir. Asif has denied Pakistan is responsible for any attack in Indian-administered Kashmir. He told the BBC: We deny it, we have not mounted anything so far. “We will not strike and then deny,” Asif said, adding that “it". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
